item.title: How I Started A Private Library When My Public Library Ditched The Classics
item.description: The private library movement is growing around the English-speaking world, as public libraries ditch worthwhile classics.

item.title: Lincoln’s Political Rise Shows Americans’ Indefatigable Pioneer Spirit
item.description: As the nation approaches its 250th birthday, that pioneer spirit — of striving and thriving, and of merit overcoming obstacles placed in its path — ca...

item.title: Minnesota Supreme Court Sides With Public Nudity, Against Families And Sanity
item.description: Greenlighting public nudity is not just normalizing objectification, but dissolving the sacredness of sex and healthy boundaries around it.

item.title: ‘There Are Chinese Spies At Stanford’: Bombshell Report Reveals CCP Student Espionage
item.description: The CCP is actively recruiting or coercing Chinese students and scholars at Stanford to serve as non-traditional intelligence assets.

item.title: The Ongoing Failure Of Affirmative Action
item.description: Wall Street Journal columnist Jason Riley returns with a second book written on why special considerations aren't helping black people succeed.
